translated: Sutra of the King of Vows of Bodhisattva Samantabhadra
The Honored One of all the worlds in the ten directions, the lion among men who roams through the three times,
My body, speech, and mind are endowed with purity, therefore I now bow down everywhere.
By the power of the vows of the practices of Samantabhadra, the supreme characteristics manifest before me.
My body is as numerous as the dust particles of the lands, with a sincere mind I humbly bow to the Great Sage.
On each dust particle, there are Buddhas as numerous as the dust particles, each surrounded by Buddha's disciples.
These Dharma realms are boundless and endless, the Tathagatas pervade them all, I should have supreme understanding.
The measure of these oceans of virtues is difficult to exhaust, with words I branch out and form endless bonds.
Because I expound the merits and virtues of the Buddhas, I will praise all the excellent vows.
The most excellent and wonderful flowers and flower garlands, the most excellent and wonderful lamps and incense burners,
Sounds, scented oils, and jeweled canopies, I respectfully make offerings to all the Buddhas.
The most excellent and wonderful garments and fragrant incense, powdered incense piled up like Mount Sumeru,
With all the most excellent and wondrous adornments, I respectfully make offerings to the one who wanders well.
Deeply believing in the power of Samantabhadra's vows, I make such unsurpassed and vast offerings.
All of this I offer to the buddhas in the ten directions, respectfully making offerings to all of them.
If it is due to greed, anger, or delusion, or due to actions of body, speech, or mind,
If I have done anything unwholesome, I now repent of it all before the TathÄgatas.
The buddhas and bodhisattvas in the ten directions, the pratyekabuddhas, those still learning and those beyond learning,
And the merits of all sentient beings, I rejoice in them all.
Those who have become lamps in the worlds of the ten directions, may they realize the non-attachment of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.
Thus, to all the great guides, I request them to turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.
If there are buddhas who wish to enter nirvana, for the sake of all sentient beings,
I will join my palms and kneel, requesting them to remain for as many eons as there are atoms in the buddha-lands.
Prostrations, offerings, repentance, rejoicing, requesting, and exhorting
I will use all the little roots of goodness I have accumulated to dedicate them to great enlightenment
I will make offerings to all the well-gone ones of the past in the ten directions, as well as to those who abide in the world
I will quickly fulfill the vows of all the well-gone ones of the future and enable them to realize enlightenment
I will cause all the lands in the ten directions to become vast and pure
May the honored ones who are equal to the Bodhisattvas under the tree, as well as the Buddha's disciples, have their wishes fulfilled
May all sentient beings in the ten directions attain pure and constant bliss
May the Dharma meanings of all sentient beings be accomplished according to their wishes
I will practice all the bodhisattva practices and aspire to be reborn in the six destinies with the wisdom of past lives
Whenever I receive a body in the world, may I always succeed in leaving the household life
In accordance with the supreme practices, I will cultivate and complete the practices of Samantabhadra
May the pure precepts be free from defilement, always without defects or blemishes.
Devas, nagas, yakshas, kumbhandas, humans, and all kinds of beings make various sounds.
I will follow each and every sound and expound the Dharma for them.
Well-disciplined and diligent, cultivating the ten perfections, always vowing not to forget the bodhi mind.
All evils that create obstacles, may they all be completely eliminated.
Karma, afflictions, and the path of Mara, in the world, attain liberation.
Not attached to water, like a lotus flower, unimpeded through space, like the sun and moon.
In all the lands of the ten directions, may the sufferings of the evil realms be completely eliminated.
Establishing sentient beings in a place of peace and happiness, benefiting all beings with beneficial practices.
Able to perfect the practices of bodhi, in accordance with sentient beings, turning those practices.
Revealing the practices of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva, practicing these practices for future kalpas.
I wish to always follow them.

Surrounded by Buddha's disciples, dwelling in the midst of honor, I gaze upon the practices of the Bodhisattvas.
Thus, in the boundless multitudes in all directions, the three times are borne upon a single hair.
The Buddhas and their lands are as vast as the ocean, their practices as numerous as the ocean over many eons.
With a single sound, the branches of speech reach the great ocean, all of them the pure voice of the Buddhas.
In accordance with the intentions of the multitudes, they expound the teachings. I vow to always follow the teachings of the Buddhas.
Wandering through the three times, among the most victorious, when turning the unsurpassed Dharma wheel,
The inexhaustible teachings of the Buddhas above, I shall skillfully enter them with the power of wisdom.
All the many eons of the future, I shall realize them in a single instant.
Thus, the eons of the three times, within a moment, I shall practice.
Wandering through the three times, among the lion-like humans, in a single moment, I shall gaze upon them all.
Always in the superior realm of the Buddhas, realized through the power of the liberation of illusion,
The adornments of all lands in the three times are used to establish a single particle,
In this way, in all directions, I also wish to adorn the Buddha lands everywhere.
All future world-realizers will realize equal enlightenment and turn the Dharma wheel,
Demonstrating entry into nirvana and realizing the ultimate reality. I vow to practice in front of all Buddhas.
May the spiritual powers swiftly go everywhere, using the power of the Great Vehicle to enter the universal gate.
Using the power of practicing practices and universal merits, the power of great compassion is universally fulfilled.
Universally in all wholesome and meritorious powers, with the power of great wisdom free from attachment,
The power of wisdom, skillful means, and various concentrations, may one correctly cultivate the power of enlightenment.
Always using the power of pure karmic actions, forever eliminating the power of all afflictions,
The power of demonic actions is rendered powerless, and the power of practicing the universal conduct is perfected.
All lands are like oceans, causing all sentient beings' oceans to be liberated.
All dharmas are like the ocean, to be fully seen; wisdom is like the ocean, to be well realized.
Practices are like the ocean, to be purified; vows are like the ocean, to be fulfilled.
All buddhas are like the ocean, to be made offerings to; passing through kalpas like the ocean, practicing without weariness.
The most honored one in the three times, to whom I go for refuge; the many bodhisattva practices and vows,
I will perfect them through the practice of Samantabhadra.
Most honored among all the Buddha's disciples, therefore called Samantabhadra.
Practicing together with this great wisdom, thus I dedicate all these wholesome roots.
Body, speech, and mind actions are extremely pure; practicing to purify all lands is also pure.
How does Samantabhadra skillfully dedicate? I vow to practice just like him.
Practicing the extremely good practice of Samantabhadra, I will also practice the great vows of Manjushri.
In future kalpas, never weary or tired, all the bodhisattva practices will be perfected.
May such practices be immeasurable, and may the blessings also be immeasurable.
Abiding in such immeasurable practices, may I know all the transformations.
If the end of space is reached, sentient beings are also inexhaustible in the same way.
The end of karma and afflictions is reached, and the extent of my vows is also like this.
The immeasurable lands in the ten directions are adorned with various treasures and offered to all Buddhas.
The supreme bliss of humans and all beings is offered for as many eons as there are dust particles in the lands.
Is there anyone who hears this dedication sutra and deeply believes in great enlightenment in accordance with it?
Only by giving rise to a single faith in this will one accomplish the supreme accumulation of merit and virtue.
If one gives rise to this universal vow of Samantabhadra, one will be far removed from all evil destinies.
Moreover, by abandoning all evil friends, this person will quickly see Amitabha.
All of them will attain the supreme life span, and the one with a human body in this life will come well.
There are such great bodhisattvas as Samantabhadra, all of whom are able to quickly accomplish in no long time.
Who, by the power of ignorance, commits the five heinous crimes and other offenses,
If that person recites this vow of Samantabhadra, they will immediately attain the eternal limit.
In all forms and appearances, as well as in wisdom, family lineage, and physical appearance, they will be perfect and complete.
Demons and non-Buddhists will not be able to subdue them, and they will be revered in the three realms.
For the sake of all sentient beings, they will quickly attain peace under the Bodhi tree.
They will attain perfect enlightenment and turn the wheel of the Dharma, subduing all the armies of Mara.
If one practices the vows of Samantabhadra's conduct, and upholds, recites, and explains them,
Only the Buddha knows the rewards of this, do not doubt the unsurpassed enlightenment.
It is like the wisdom and virtue of Manjushri, and the bodhisattva Samantabhadra is also like this.
I follow in their practice and study, and dedicate all these good roots.
